WorkItem.Description:
I refortged the chest on my bear 101 Crit --> Dodge but even after waiting 2 days, resetting all caches and re-importing from battle.net, the UI still recommends reforging crit to dodge as thought I had never reforged the item.
Â 
Is this functionality not yet implemented?

Comments.Message: uhhh its been implemented a while dude. zif te paper doll says to reforge to dodge and you already did that and its importing saying that then that is right. What is the issue?
Well "dude", if the UI was showing the dodge on the item, I wouldn't have said "the UI still recommends reforging crit to dodge as thought I had never reforged the item."

"the UI still recommends regoring crit to dodge" <-- is that on an Optimizer Results window?

Immediately after importing the character from Battle.Net, before doing anything else, what does the little Reforging box for your Chest item say?

Posting Guidelines:
* Please attach your Character file.
* Please attach the Region/Realm/Name of the Character used for importing.

http://us.battle.net/wow/en/character/eldrethalas/jocund/simple

When I hover over the chest icon on the left side of Rawr, it says:  Reforge 101 Crit Rating --> Dodge (I can send a screen snip if you like, but I'll have to create another reply.)
As you can see from my battle.net armory link above the chest says Reforged (101 Crit Rating --> 101 Dodge Rating) 
It also has another line that says Eqip: Increases your dodge rating by 101.
Again, in Rawr, my chest continues to appear just as it did before I reforged it.

Uh...

So what you're saying is... It's working fine?

The "Reforge 101 Crit Rating --> Dodge" means the same thing as "Reforged (101 Crit Rating --> 101 Dodge Rating". I don't understand what the problem is, we don't list the 101 Dodge in the stats section because its listed as part of the Reforge statement.
I think I see what you are saying.  I'll reforge my legs and see if I get it.
OK, I am unconfused.  Sorry about the senile dementia.  I am 65 years old and the brain synapses don't seem to work as well as they used to!
